To determine the cross-section for a neutron-induced fission reaction in a uranium-235 nucleus at an incident energy of 1 MeV, we can refer to experimental data and previous research. The cross-section values for various energies have been measured and tabulated in nuclear data libraries.

For uranium-235 at an incident neutron energy of 1 MeV, the fission cross-section is approximately 1.5 barns (1 barn = 10^-28 m^2). This value is obtained from experimental data and is considered constant in this energy range.

It is important to note that the cross-section value is an average value, and it may vary slightly depending on the specific conditions and experimental setup. However, 1.5 barns can be used as a reasonable approximation for the cross-section of a neutron-induced fission reaction in a uranium-235 nucleus at an incident energy of 1 MeV.
